text: Robert William Holley (January 28, 1922; Urbana, Illinois â€“ February 11, 1993) was an American biochemist. He shared the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, which he won for describing the structures for alanine transfer RNA, linking DNA and protein synthesis. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:1993 deaths Category:American biochemists Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:Scientists from Urbana, Illinois
title: Robert W. Holley
